result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zori L. Hunt

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on January 17, 2023 at 11:00 am.

8:57 AM Defendant Zori L. Hunt in court.  Attorney Ryan W O'Hara in court for Zori L. Hunt.  Prosecuting attorney Cheniqua White in court for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 11:00 am.
Calendar call on September 28, 2022 at 08:45 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and Arraignment
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:49 AM Defendant Zori L. Hunt in court by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video. Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Sargent Shannon Dykstra of Beloit Police Department sworn testimony taken by video; Witness identified the defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects with argument and asks for for matter to be dismissed. Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information. Information filed, copy to Defendant's attorney, reading waived. Defendant's attorney pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set. Parties argue modification of bond conditions. Court modifies bond condition: No contact directly or indirectly with victim Z.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere, except for contact specifically authorized by CPS. Follow any CPS safety plan in place. Defendant to sign bond at courthouse on June 8, 2022 between 12 and 1PM. Remand to branch 1 for scheduling.

No contact directly or indirectly with victim Z.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere, except for contact specifically authorized by CPS. Follow any CPS safety plan in place.
Preliminary hearing on June 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Activity:  Adjourned initial appearance  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:47 PM Defendant Zori L. Hunt in court by video with attorney Ryan W O'Hara by video.  Gerald Anthony Urbik appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary Hearing requested by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 10:45 am.

Activity: initial appearance

Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $500.00   with conditions,   No contact directly or indirectly with victim Z.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Follow any CPS safety plan in place. Matter continued to allow defendant time to obtain an attorney. Adjourned initial appearance May 12, 2022 at 3:00 pm.
No contact directly or indirectly with victim Z.M., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Follow any CPS safety plan in place.
